title: Now In My Late 20s, These Are A Few Things I Don't Give A Damn About In A Relationship

Now In My Late 20s, These Are A Few Things I Don't Give A Damn About In A Relationship

Now In My Late 20s, These Are A Few Things I Don't Give A Damn About In A Relationship

The definition of a relationship has now changed for me. I figured out how people love at different stages of life. While we all know how teenage love is, relationships in your late twenties show you a completely different side of love.

Now that I've matured and grown as an individual, relationships are not tasking anymore. I try to keep it simple because my relationship is not the only thing in my life.

Here are a few things I don't give a damn about in a relationship anymore.

1. I don't feel like sending or receiving 'good morning' texts from my partner.

Unsplash

2. I don't want to know where my partner is going or who is he meeting on a daily basis.

Unsplash

3. I do not want to hear 'I love you' from my partner. The constant validation is not required.

Unsplash

4. I understand how alone time is also needed and is dear to individuals. I do not interpret is as 'he doesn't need me anymore.'

Unsplash

5. So what if my partner is not there at a party I am going to?

Unsplash

6. I do not react to every little detail even if it bothers me. I'd like to keep myself calm which eventually makes me think better.

Unsplash

7. I do not throw unnecessary tantrums to create more chaos in my life just because something terrible at work happened.

Unsplash

8. I am comfortable with complete silence around my partner.

Unsplash

9. I do not make my partner take decisions about his life around me because that is not the right way.

Unsplash

10. I do not have to buy sexy lingerie to have that brilliant session with my partner.

Unsplash

11. I do not feel the need to have someone to complete me. I am complete with myself and it does not question my love for my partner.
